item.title: A-levels and GCSEs: U-turn as teacher estimates to be used for exam results
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson apologises to students and parents for the "distress" caused.

item.title: A-level results U-turn: Students relieved and annoyed
item.description: Some don't know if the rule change means their original university offers still stand.

item.title: Dewsbury family 'devastated' by brothers' drowning in sea
item.description: The boys, aged 16 and 18, from West Yorkshire got into difficulties off the Lancashire coast.

item.title: Mother in court charged with murdering son in Acton
item.description: Olga Freeman, 40, is accused of killing Dylan Freeman, described as a "beautiful, bright" child.

item.title: Coronavirus: Exams U-turn and socially-distanced salsa
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Monday evening.

item.title: A-levels: Student foresaw exam crisis in winning story
item.description: The Orwell Youth Prize winner says she has "fallen into her own story" about an exam algorithm.

item.title: Louisiana man goes from hospital security guard to medical student
item.description: Russell Ledet hopes to use his story to inspire black youths "to make an impact".

item.title: Portugal president helps rescue two women caught at sea
item.description: President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa assists the women as their kayak capsizes amid strong currents.

item.title: 'Highest temperature on Earth' as Death Valley, US hits 54.4C
item.description: A reading of 130F (54.4C) recorded in Death Valley could be the highest reliable recording ever.

item.title: Belarus protests: Workers boo Lukashenko as election unrest spreads
item.description: A factory photo op for Alexander Lukashenko backfires when workers demand his resignation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Party links to Glasgow and Lanarkshire clusters
item.description: Dozens of students are self-isolating as cases in north east Glasgow and Lanarkshire are officially linked.

item.title: Barcelona sack Setien after Bayern defeat
item.description: Barcelona sack manager Quique Setien after his side's humiliating 8-2 defeat by Bayern Munich in the Champions League.

item.title: Sheringham seawater turns brown due to flooding
item.description: Overflowing drains gushed silt and dust into the North Sea off the Norfolk coast.

item.title: BTec missing results: 'We've been forgotten about'
item.description: BTec results were due last Thursday but a number of students still haven't received them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Poorer children's education could take 'over a year' to recover
item.description: The BBC filmed in a school in St Helens, in which over 60% of pupils receive free school meals.

item.title: The Crown: Elizabeth Debicki to play Princess Diana in final series
item.description: The Australian actress will take over from Emma Corrin for the final two seasons of the Netflix show.

item.title: Coronavirus: Socially-distanced salsa 'stretches imagination'
item.description: Latin dancing is all about the romance, but things look a little different these days.

item.title: Boa constrictor captured beside River Thames at Barnes
item.description: The 5ft snake, thought to have been abandoned, was spotted near Barnes Bridge in south-west London.

item.title: The last meals of US prisoners on death row
item.description: Photographer Jackie Black recreated the meals requested by US prisoners before they were executed.

item.title: Body positivity campaigners: 'It’s not just about eat less, move more’
item.description: Body positivity campaigners say the government's obesity strategy "blames" bigger people for Covid-19.

item.title: Stormzy's first anti-racism donation revealed
item.description: The rapper pledged £10m over 10 years to tackle racial inequality earlier this year.

item.title: US conventions: What happens? And what's different in 2020?
item.description: It's convention season in the US election, but this year won't be like previous ones.

item.title: Sepsis: Boy learns to walk again after losing legs
item.description: Four-year-old William from Nottinghamshire almost died after contracting sepsis.

item.title: The two students who took on Coke and Pepsi
item.description: German friends Mirco Wiegert and Lorenz Hampl launched best-selling Fritz-Kola in 2003.

item.title: Wellingborough floods 'flung the door open as I was tattooing'
item.description: Businesses are picking up the pieces as a town is hit by most of its monthly rainfall in an hour.

item.title: Egypt TikTok and Instagram stars pay heavy price for 'indecency'
item.description: They have millions of followers, but Egypt's social media stars are paying a heavy price.

item.title: 'They haven't found anyone else out there like me'
item.description: Charlotte Evans suffers from an undiagnosed condition that causes parts of her body to swell.

item.title: Belarus protests: 'There's no way back. The people will not forgive this'
item.description: Belarusian media figures tell the BBC how their lives have been turned upside down during the protests.

item.title: Joe Biden: Where does the US presidential hopeful stand on key issues?
item.description: Where does the 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful stand on key issues for voters in the election?

item.title: The couple blamed for an Islamic State attack on their wedding
item.description: An Islamic State bomb devastated the happiest day of Rehana and Mirwais' life - then they were blamed.

item.title: The medical school trying to become anti-racist
item.description: Students campaigned for changes to training so they are better prepared for patients from minority backgrounds.

item.title: Prosopagnosia: The artist in search of her face
item.description: Carlotta is a prolific self portrait artist from Munich with prosopagnosia - face blindness.

item.title: Democratic National Convention: What to watch for at Biden's nomination party
item.description: Covid may have spoiled the party in Wisconsin, but there's still a lot you need to know about the virtual event.

item.title: Belarus protests: 'We can breathe for the first time in our lives'
item.description: After 26 years of President Lukashenko's rule, there is a sense of euphoria among protesters.

item.title: England and Pakistan draw rain-hit second Test - report & highlights
item.description: England and Pakistan play out an inevitable draw in the second Test at the Ageas Bowl.

item.title: Halep becomes sixth woman in top 10 to pull out of US Open
item.description: World number two and reigning Wimbledon champion Simona Halep is the latest top 10 women's player to withdraw from the US Open.

item.title: Watch: The best shots of the World Championship
item.description: Watch the best shots from the 2020 World Snooker Championship - and find out which one has been chosen as the overall winner.

item.title: England v Pakistan highlights: Zak Crawley hits fifty in rain-affected draw
item.description: Watch highlights as Zak Crawley lights up the final day of a rain-affected draw between England and Pakistan in Southampton.

item.title: Bad light issue must be addressed by authorities - Root
item.description: The problem of bad light stopping play "needs looking at" by the authorities, says England captain Joe Root.

item.title: Former England keeper Hart to join Spurs after leaving Burnley
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Joe Hart is set to join Tottenham Hotspur on a free transfer after leaving Burnley.

item.title: A-levels and GCSEs: How did the exam algorithm work?
item.description: The government has made a U-turn on A-level results in England, but what sparked such controversy?

item.title: Exam results: How will universities cope with extra students? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: Exam results: Where did it go wrong and what happens next?
item.description: How a preoccupation with standards and an algorithm led to "unfathomable" exam results.

item.title: 'They have really embarrassed themselves'
item.description: A-level student Nina welcomes the government's U-turn which means she can train to become a vet.

item.title: GCSE and A-level exams: Williamson 'incredibly sorry for exams unfairness'
item.description: The education secretary says it was "the right thing to act" when it became clear results were unfair.

item.title: A-levels: Three more Oxford University colleges to honour offers
item.description: St Edmund Hall, New College and Jesus College say they will admit all UK offer-holders.

item.title: BTec Nationals: Who are the students who didn't just do A-levels?
item.description: All about the BTec National, one of the popular alternatives to A-levels.

item.title: GCSE's and A-levels: Students to be awarded teacher predicted grades
item.description: The head of Ofqual apologises to students for the distress caused by results produced by an algorithm.

item.title: GCSEs: NI results to be based on teacher predictions
item.description: Education Minister Peter Weir says the move is being made due to "exceptional circumstances".
